meaning: adjective: strongly affectionate towards
example: Even though her father did not approve, Juliet became besotted with the young Romeo.

meaning: noun: cunning tricks used to deceive others
example: The mayoral candidates both spent much of the campaign accusing each other of artifices designed to mislead the voting public.

meaning: verb: express strong disapproval of
example: The manager spent an hour objurgating the employee in the hopes that he would not make these mistakes again.

meaning: verb: become feeble
example: Stranded in the wilderness for four days, the hiker languished, eating protein bars and nuts.

meaning: verb: do something that one considers to be below one's dignity
example: The master of the house never deigned to answer questions from the servants.

meaning: verb: express discontent or a strong regret
example: While the CFO carefully explained all the reasons for the cuts in benefits, after the meeting employees bemoaned the cuts as further evidence that management was against them.

meaning: adjective: supplying added support
example: In hiking Mt. Everest, sherpas are appurtenant, helping climbers both carry gear and navigate treacherous paths.

meaning: adjective: marked by high spirits or excitement
example: After the sales result, the manager was in an effervescent mood, letting several employees leave work early that day.

meaning: adjective: filled with or evoking sadness
example: No event is more doleful than the passing of my mother; she was a shining star in my life, and it brings me great sadness to think that she is now gone.

meaning: verb: suppress or crush completely
example: After the dictator consolidated his power, he took steps to squelch all criticism, often arresting any journalist who said anything that could be interpreted as negative about his regime.

meaning: adjective: too sacred to be uttered; defying expression or description
example: While art critics can occasionally pinpoint a work's greatness, much of why a piece captures our imaginations is completely ineffable.

meaning: noun: a strong verbal attack
example: Political broadsides are usually strongest in the weeks leading up to a national election.

meaning: noun: model of excellence or perfection of a kind; one having no equal
example: Even with the rise of Kobe Bryant, many still believe that Michael Jordon is the paragon for basketball players.

meaning: adjective: like a meteor in speed or brilliance or transience
example: The early spectacular successes propelled the pitcher to meteoric stardom, but a terrible injury tragically cut short his career.

meaning: noun: a reappearance of an earlier characteristic; throwback
example: Much of the modern art movement was an atavism to a style of art found only in small villages through Africa and South America.

meaning: verb: to break out or happen again
example: After years of gamblers anonymous, Tony thought he'd broken his compulsive slot machine playing, but it took only one trip to the Atlantic City for a full recrudescence--he lost $5k on the one armed bandit.

meaning: adjective: threatening or foreshadowing evil or tragic developments
example: Movies often use storms or rain clouds as a baleful omen of evil events that will soon befall the main character.

meaning: noun: abusive or venomous language used to express blame or bitter deep-seated ill will
example: His vitriol spewed forth from a deep-seated racism that consumed his whole life.

meaning: adjective: not real or genuine; phony
example: The car dealer's ersatz laughter was immediately followed by a price quote, one that Shelley found highly inflated.

meaning: noun: defiant aggressiveness
example: When the boss confronted Aaron about his earlier remarks, Aaron responded with utter truculence, simply throwing a glass of water in the boss' face and walking away.

meaning: noun: any method that derives knowledge from experience, used in experimental science as a way to gain insight and knowledge
example: Empiricism does not always lead to knowledge; an experience or experiment may raise more questions than it answers.

meaning: adjective: ancient
example: Most workout gurus are young, fit people, whereas most yoga gurus are hoary men with long white beards.

meaning: adjective: having a sophisticated charm
example: James Bond is known for his good looks, high tech gadgets, and debonair manner.

meaning: verb: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
example: While she was at the chalkboard, the teacher did not brook any form of talking--even a tiny peep resulted in afternoon detention.

meaning: noun: a retaliatory action against an enemy in wartime
example: The Old Testament doctrine of "an eye for an eye" would seem to justify an immediate physical reprisal for any injury, but that interpretation neglects the many passages that value mercy and loving-kindness over revenge.

meaning: noun: something to be imitated
example: Lena's homework is on the wall because it is an exemplar of clean, neat, and thoughtful work.

meaning: noun: something that is inappropriate for the given time period (usually something old).
example: Dressed in 15th century clothing each day, Edward was a walking anachronism.

meaning: noun: total lack of meaning or ideas
example: Bill's poem was nothing more than a list of impressive sounding words, so there was no point in trying to take meaning from the inanity.

meaning: adjective: ludicrously odd
example: The clown's antic act was too extreme for the youngest children, who left the room in tears.

meaning: noun: a maneuver or risk in a game or conversation, designed to secure an advantage
example: Randy played a gambit, telling his boss that he would leave at the end of the week if he didn't get a raise.

meaning: noun: strong feelings of embarrassment
example: Much to the timid writer's chagrin, the audience chanted his name until he came back on the stage.

meaning: adjective: creating an unfavorable or neutral first impression
example: World leaders coming to meet Gandhi would expect a towering sage, and often would be surprised by the unprepossessing little man dressed only in a loincloth and shawl.

meaning: noun: a witty saying
example: My favorite epigram from Mark Twain is "A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn no other way."

meaning: adjective: highly perceptive
example: Even the most percipient editor will make an occasional error when proofreading.

meaning: verb: seize and control without authority
example: Arriving at the small town, the outlaw arrogated the privileges of a lord, asking the frightened citizens to provide food, drink, and entertainment.

meaning: adjective: not confined or limited
example: The whole notion of living untrammeled inspired the American Revolution and was enshrined in the Declaration of Independence and the Constitution.

meaning: noun: something desired or wished for but is only an illusion and impossible to achieve
example: Many believe that a world free of war is a chimeraâ€”a dream that ignores humanity's violent tendencies.

meaning: adjective: not straightforward; giving a false appearance of frankness
example: Many adults think that they can lie to children, but kids are smart and know when people are disingenuous.

meaning: adjective: smug and ignorant towards artistic and cultural values
example: Jane considered Al completely philistine, because he talked almost exclusively about video games; she was entirely unaware of how well read he really was.

meaning: noun: a short, pithy instructive saying
example: Winston Churchill is famous for many apothegms, but this might be his most famous: "It has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all the others that have been tried."

meaning: adjective: causing irritation or annoyance
example: Maria found her coworker's cell phone nettlesome, because every few minutes it would buzz to life with another text message.

meaning: noun: a feeling of excessive concern
example: I walked to his house in the rain to make sure he had enough to eat while he was sick, but he seemed not to appreciate my solicitude.

meaning: verb: react in an offended or angry manner
example: As we discussed the painting, I noticed the artist's wife bristling at our criticisms, ready to defend her husband's work.

meaning: adjective: in an early stage of development
example: The Board of Directors is hoping to launch a new product soon, but planning for the Z7 is in an embryonic stage.

meaning: adjective: showing little emotion
example: Arnold is truly noble, remaining reserved until an issue of significance arises, but Walter is simply phlegmatic: he doesn't have the energy or inclination to care about anything.

meaning: adjective: only partly in existence; imperfectly formed
example: Inchoate ideas about the relation of humans to other animals had been discussed since the Middle Ages but the modern theory really began with Darwin.

meaning: verb: be bossy towards; discourage or frighten with threats or a domineering manner
example: During the interrogation, the suspect was browbeaten into signing a false confession.

meaning: noun: the most essential part of something
example: When Cynthia hears a speaker presenting a complex argument, she is always able to discard the irrelevant details and extract the pith of what the speaker is trying to convey.

meaning: adjective: very generous
example: Helen is unstinting with her time, often spending hours at the house of a sick friend.

meaning: noun: the reestablishing of cordial relations
example: Although Ann hoped that her mother and her aunt would have a rapprochement, each one's bitter accusations against the other made any reconciliation unlikely.
